title: Juventus respond to rumours Man Utd are set to sign Mario Mandzukic
text:
Manchester United are confident of signing Juventus misfit Mario Mandzukic (Picture: Getty)

Juventus sporting director Fabio Paratici has confirmed that he will hold talks with Mario Mandzukic amid rumours the forward is set to join Manchester United.

Mandzukic, 33, has become a peripheral figure in Turin and is yet to play a competitive match for the Serie A champions since Maurizio Sarri took over the reins from Massimiliano Allegri in the summer.

Juve are open to offers for Mandzukic ahead of the January transfer window, with Cristiano Ronaldo, Paulo Dybala and Gonzalo Higuain all ahead of the Croatian in the pecking order.

Recent reports claim United are confident of landing Mandzukic for a fee of £9million in the new year. It’s understood the veteran striker will be offered an 18-month contract and wages of £4.4m-a-year.

Mandzukic has been frozen out by new Juventus manager Sarri (Picture: Getty)

Mandzukic’s move to Qatari outfit Al Rayyan collapsed in the summer, but it appears he could finally be on his way out of Juventus this winter.

‘With Mandzukic, we chose a quiet time for him to leave but a move to Qatar [in the summer] did not materialise so he stayed with us,’ Juve director Paratici told AS.

‘Now we will talk to him and see what happens in January.’

Rashford has struggled as United’s lead striker this season (Picture: Getty)

Dimitar Berbatov has backed United’s bid to sign Mandzukic and believes the Croatia international could have an impact similar to Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s at Old Trafford.

‘They have the talent in the young players but at the same time you need someone like Mandzukic,’ the ex-United star told Betfair.

‘I think he is a really good football player and he hasn’t played before in England, but I hope if he comes he can straight away get into the rhythm of the Premier League.

‘Zlatan Ibrahimovic was 34 years old when he signed for United and he didn’t have any problems.

‘Mandzukic is a similar age and hope he could have the same impact if he signs. ‘I think his age is a good thing, [Anthony] Martial, Rashford and [Mason] Greenwood are all young players so they need that time and assurance that they don’t need to worry and they can learn from the experience of Mandzukic.’

Berbatov added: ‘The winter transfer window is going to be difficult and on the pitch Manchester United aren’t producing as a team at the moment.

‘It doesn’t matter how good you are, Lionel Messi or Cristiano Ronaldo could go there and they would have difficulty because the team is not producing.’
